revision.text:
{{Infobox weapon |name= Stridsvagn 122 |image=Strv122 3 cropped.jpg |image_size= 300px |origin=Germany
Sweden |type=[[Main battle tank]] |is_vehicle=yes |is_UK=no |service=1997–present Lindström, Rickard O. and Svantesson, Carl-Gustaf (2009). ''Svenskt Pansar 90 år av svensk stridsfordonsutveckling'', p. 112. Bookwell, Finland. ISBN 978 91 85789 375. |used_by=[[Swedish Army]] |wars= |designer= |design_date= |manufacturer=[[BAE Systems AB]] |unit_cost= [[US$]]5.74 million |production_date=1994-present |number=120 (91 license-produced in Sweden) |variants= ''Strv 122''
''Strv 122B'' |weight= {{convert|62.5|t}}[http://fmv.se/sv/Projekt/Stridsvagn-121-och-122-Leopard-2-/Fakta/ Swedish Defence Materiel Administration: Leopard 2 – Stridsvagn 122 Facts (Swedish)] |length= {{convert|9.97|m|ftin|abbr=on}} (gun forward) |width= {{convert|3.75|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |height= {{convert|3.0|m|ftin|abbr=on}} |crew= 4 |armour= 3rd generation composite; including high-hardness steel, tungsten and plastic filler with ceramic component. |primary_armament=1 x [[Rheinmetall 120 mm Gun|120 mm Rheinmetall L44]] smoothbore gun
42 rounds |secondary_armament=2 x [[7.62×51mm NATO]] [[Rheinmetall MG 3|Ksp m/94]] machine gun
4,750 rounds
4 x 2 GALIX [[Grenade launcher#Description|smoke grenade launchers]] |engine=[[MTU Friedrichshafen|MTU]] MB 873 Ka-501 [[Radiator (engine cooling)|liquid-cooled]] [[V12 engine|V-12]] [[Twin-turbo]] [[diesel engine]] |engine_power= 1,500 PS (1,479 hp, 1,103 kW) at 2,600 rpm |transmission=Renk HSWL 354 |fuel_capacity= 1,200 [[liters]] (317 US [[gallon]]s; 264 imp. gal) |pw_ratio={{convert|24.19|PS/t|abbr=on}} |suspension=[[Torsion-bar suspension]] |clearance=540 mm |vehicle_range={{convert|550|km|mi|abbr=on}} (internal fuel) |speed={{convert|68|km/h|mph|abbr=on}} }} [[File:Swedish Leopard 2 Tank.jpg|thumb|Stridsvagn 122 during an urban warfare exercise, 2006]] '''Stridsvagn 122''' '''(Strv 122)''' ("Tank 122") is a Swedish [[main battle tank]] based on the German [[Leopard 2]]. As with the Leopard 2A5 it is based on the German [[Leopard 2#Variants|Leopard 2 Improved variant]], utilizing newer technology such as command, control, and fire control systems, as well as reinforced armour and long-term combat capacity. Externally, the vehicle can be distinguished from the Leopard 2A5 by the French GALIX smoke dispensers, different storage bins, and the thicker crew hatches.[http://www.fmv.se/WmTemplates/Page.aspx?id=1106 Swedish Defence Materiel Administration: Leopard 2 – Stridsvagn 122 (Swedish)] The ''Strv 122B'', has been equipped with modular AMAP composite armour from IBD Deisenroth to give "360° protection" against threats such as EFPs, [[rocket propelled grenade]]s and [[improvised explosive device]]s. == Features == The Leopard 2A5's width of {{convert|3.75|m}} has been kept, while the weight increased by only {{convert|350|kg}}.{{cite web |url=http://www.ibd-deisenroth-engineering.de/news/items/MBT122B_with_new_Protection.html?file=tl_files/resources/content-pdfs/2010-12%20New%20MBT122B%20Evolution%20with%20Unprecedented%20Protection.pdf |title= New MBT122B Evolution with Unprecedented Protection |accessdate=28 December 2010 |publisher=IBD Deisenroth Engineering |format=PDF}} The Stridsvagn 122 was designed to fight in Swedish conditions including heavily forested areas as well as urban terrain. The designation derives from the 12 cm gun, on the second tank in Swedish service featuring this calibre (the first being Strv 121, Leopard 2A4s fitted with Swedish lights and radios and painted in Swedish camouflage). Strv 122 also had to overcome the perceived flaws of the original German tank, and features the following abilities:[http://www.forsvarsmakten.se/sv/materiel-och-teknik/fordon/stridsvagn-122/ Sidan Kunde Inte Hittas] (in Swedish) * Heavily reinforced armour to protect against man-portable anti-tank weapons. * An advanced [[CBRN]] defence system for protection against chemical, biological and radioactive weapons. * Wading capability to pass through water up to 1.4 m deep. * Quick ability to discover, identify and lock on a target with the assistance of a [[laser rangefinder]], [[thermographic camera]], and a speed/distance/accuracy calculator for maximum accuracy. * Ability to lock onto numerous targets at once, enabling the tank to fight numerous enemy vehicles without having to manually re-aim the gun after every shot. * Active communication for improved cooperation between units. * Tank Command & Control System TCCS by Celsius Tech Systems AB. == Production and service == As of 2013, 42 of these tanks remain in active service. Most of the 160 Leopard 2 A4s (local designation Strv 121) that were originally leased are being returned to Germany.{{cite web |url=http://www.sydsvenskan.se/skane/stridsvagnar-kor-sista-varvet/ |title=Sydsvenskan: Stridsvagnar kör sista varvet |language=Swedish |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140718231258/http://www.sydsvenskan.se/skane/stridsvagnar-kor-sista-varvet/ |archive-date=2014-07-18 |access-date=2014-09-22 }} The active tanks are divided between three companies, two at [[Skaraborgs regemente (armoured)|P4, Skövde]] and one at [[Norrbottens regemente|I 19, Boden]].{{cite web | url=http://www.militaryfactory.com/armor/detail.asp?armor_id=457 | title=Stridsvagn 122 (Strv 122) Main Battle Tank (1998) | work=Militaryfactory.com | date=2011 | accessdate=23 May 2015}} == Comparison with other main battle tanks == {| class="wikitable" |- |+ Comparison of some modern main battle tanks |- valign=top ! ! style="text-align:center;" | Strv 122

{{flagicon|United Kingdom}} |- valign=top ! style="text-align:right;" | Unit cost | US$5.74 millionFoss, p. 116. | US$6.21 millionFoss, pp. 149–153 | US$4.25 million{{cite web |url=http://arms-tass.su/?page=article&aid=93690&cid=25 |title=Denial of Defense Procurement MBT T-90 is not connected with the qualitative characteristics of this sample of military equipment – Ministry of Industry of the Russian Federation |publisher=Arms-Tass |date=March 17, 2011 |accessdate=March 19, 2011}} | US$6.86 millionFoss, p. 114. | US$6.53 millionFoss, pp. 130–135 |- valign=top ! style="text-align:right;" | Weight | {{convert|68.9|ST|t|disp=out}} | {{convert|69.5 |ST|t|disp=out}}{{cite web | url=http://www.globalsecurity.org/military/systems/ground/m1-specs.htm | title=M1 Abrams Main Battle Tank | publisher=Global security.org | date=2013 | accessdate=23 May 2015 | author=Pike, John}} | {{convert|51 |ST|t|disp=out}}{{cite web | url=http://www.militaryfactory.com/armor/detail.asp?armor_id=161 | title=T-90 Main Battle Tank (MBT) (1995) | publisher=MilitaryFactory.com | date=2 February 2015 | accessdate=23 May 2015}} | {{convert|68.7|ST|t|disp=out}}{{cite web | url=http://www.military-today.com/tanks/leopard_2a5.htm | title=Leopard 2A5 Main Battle Tank | publisher=Military-today.com | date=2014 | accessdate=24 May 2015 | author=Genys, Andrius}} | {{convert|68.9 |ST|t|disp=out}}{{cite web | url=http://www.militaryfactory.com/armor/detail.asp?armor_id=11 | title=Challenger 2 Main Battle Tank (1998) | publisher=Militaryfactory.com | date=1 August 2014 | accessdate=24 May 2015}} |- valign=top ! style="text-align:right;" | Length | 9.97 metersFoss, p. 117. | 9.77 meters | 9.63 meters | 9.97 meters | 11.50 meters |- ! style="text-align:right;" | Width | 3.75 meters | 3.7 meters | 3.78 meters | 3.75 meters | 3.5 meters |- ! style="text-align:right;" | Height | 3 meters | 2.4 meters | 2.22 meters | 3 meters | 2.49 meters |- ! style="text-align:right;" | Crew | 4 | 4 | 3 | 4 | 4 |-valign=top ! style="text-align:right;" | Armour | 3rd generation [[Composite armour|composite]] | [[Depleted Uranium]] [[Chobham armour|composite]] | Composite/[[Reactive armour|reactive]] | 3rd generation composite | Dorchester Level 2 (classified) |-valign=top ! style="text-align:right;" | Main armament | 1x [[Rheinmetall 120 mm gun|120 mm Rheinmetall]] L/44 smoothbore gun | 1x [[Rheinmetall 120 mm gun|M256 120 mm]] L/44 smoothbore gun | 1x [[2A46 125 mm gun|125 mm L/48]] smoothbore gun | 1x [[Rheinmetall 120 mm gun|120 mm Rheinmetall]] L/44 smoothbore gun | 1x [[L30|120 mm L30]] L/55 rifled gun |- ! style="text-align:right;" | Main ammunition | 42 rounds | 42 rounds | 42 rounds | 42 rounds | 52 rounds |-valign=top ! style="text-align:right;" | Secondary armament | 2x 7.62mm machine guns | 1x 12.7mm heavy machine gun
2x 7.62mm machine guns | 1x 12.7mm heavy machine gun
1x 7.62mm machine gun | 2x 7.62mm machine guns | Coaxial 7.62×51mm L94A1 EX-34 (chain gun),
7.62×51mm L37A2 Commander's cupola machine gun |- ! style="text-align:right;" | Secondary ammunition | 4,750 rounds | 900 rounds
10,000 rounds | 7,000 rounds | 4,750 rounds | 4,000[http://www.army.mod.uk/equipment/23236.aspx Challenger 2 main battle tank] |- ! style="text-align:right;" | Engine power | 1,500 hp | 1,500 hp | 1,000 hp | 1,500 hp | 1,200 bhp |- ! style="text-align:right;" | Power/weight | 24.00 hp/t | 24.15 hp/t | 26.31 hp/t | 25.06 hp/t | 19.2 hp/t |-valign=top ! style="text-align:right;" |Suspension | [[Torsion-bar suspension]] | Torsion-bar suspension | Torsion-bar suspension | Torsion-bar suspension | Hydropneumatic |- ! style="text-align:right;" | Fuel capacity | 1,200 liters | 1,900 liters | | 1,200 liters | 1,592 liters |- ! style="text-align:right;" | Operational range | 550 km | 425 km | 500 km | 550 km | 550 km{{citation needed|date=September 2015}} |- ! style="text-align:right;" | Speed | 68 km/h | 68 km/h | 65 km/h | 72 km/h | 59 km/h |- |} ==Notes== {{reflist|30em}} == Sources == * {{cite book | title=Jane's Armour and Artillery | publisher=Jane's Publishing Company | author=Foss, Christopher F. | year=2002 | isbn=978-0-7106-0964-9}} == External links == {{commons category|Stridsvagn 122}} * [http://www.soldf.com/strv122.html Stridsvagn 122 – Strv122] [[Category:Main battle tanks of Sweden]]
